title: Jimmy McGriff - 43 Albums - Jazz Organ
description:
Jimmy McGriff - 43 Albums

Jimmy McGriff (April 3, 1936 - May 24, 2008) was one of the all-time giants of the Hammond B-3 organ. He was almost certainly the bluesiest of the major soul-jazz pioneers.

His rearrangement of Ray Charles 'I Got A Woman' was a Top Five R&B hit in 1962, and further hits like 'All About My Girl', 'Kiko' and 'The Worm' followed over the course of the '60s.

List of included albums:

1962 I've Got A Woman
1964 Blues For Mister Jimmy
1965 Where The Action's At!
1966 A Bag Full Of Soul
1966 Let's Stay Together
1966 Cherry
1967 A Bag Full Of Blues
1968 Honey
1968 The Worm
1968 Step 1
1969 A Thing To Come By
1969 The Way You Look Tonight
1969 Electric Funk
1970 Something To Listen To
1971 Black Pearl
1971 Good Things Don't Happen Every Day
1971 Soul Sugar
1971 Groove Grease
1972 Fly Dude
1973 Giants Of The Organ Come Together
1973 If You're Ready, Come Go With Me
1973 Giants Of The Organ In Concert
1974 The Main Squeeze
1975 Stump Juice
1976 The Mean Machine
1976 Read Beans
1977 Tailgunner
1978 Outside Looking In
1981 City Lights
1982 The Groover
1983 Countdown
1984 Skywalk
1986 Soul Survivors
1986 The Starting Five
1987 Steppin' Up
1988 Blue To The 'Bone
1996 The Dream Team
1997 Greatest Hits
1997 Road Tested
1998 Straight Up
1999 McGriff's House Party
2000 Feelin' It
2001 The Best Of Hank Crawford & Jimmy McGriff

----------

MP3 format. All songs are tagged by the book.

The quality of these rips varies, from high quality CD rips to low quality LP rips.

If you encounter errors during the file sharing, please, place this material as close to the root of the hard disk as possible and restart the file sharing (e.g. as close as possible to C: in Windows). This is in order to make the path (drive, directory and filename) as short as possible. Operating systems have limits regarding how long a path including the filename can be, and if this limit is exceeded there will be errors.
